alert.note: Alert for Jefferson; Madison (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 30 at 10:17AM EDT until August 30 at 12:45PM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: The National Weather Service in Tallahassee has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Northeastern Jefferson County in Big Bend Florida... Northwestern Madison County in Big Bend Florida... Brooks County in south central Georgia... Northwestern Lowndes County in south central Georgia... Southeastern Thomas County in south central Georgia... * Until 1245 PM EDT. * At 1017 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Monticello, Quitman, Valdosta, Hahira, Boston, Pavo, Morven, Barwick, Dixie, Pidcock, Brooks Co A/p, Grooverville, Empress, Oaklawn, Ashville, Lovett, Everett, Blue Springs, Dills and Hollis. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
